diagnosis.final_diagnosis: severe bronchospasm associated with rapacuronium administration
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient displayed severe bronchospasm and oxygen desaturation after the administration of rapacuronium, which was noted to coincide with the decline in oxygen saturation despite adequate preoxygenation and normal findings during physical exams. Key events included a rapid decrease in O2 saturation to 70% and the presence of truncal erythema, leading to the administration of albuterol and progressively easier ventilation.
